Question 78) TEXT I two things fill the ever -growing mood of admiration and veneration: the starry sky over me and the moral law in me.
Text II Two things admire: the hard law covering me and the starry heaven within me.
Fontela, O. Kant (reread). In: Complete poetry. Sao Paulo: Hedra, 2015.
The rereading performed by the poet reverses the following central ideas of Kantian thought:
A) Possibility of freedom and obligation of action.
B) APPARATION OF JUDGMENT AND IMPORTANCE OF NATURE.
C) Need of goodwill and criticism of metaphysics.
D) prescription of the empirical and authority of reason.
E) interiority of norm and phenomenality of the world.
